duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage, analyze, and administer employer compensation programs aligned with company objectives for recruiting, retention, and employee engagement.
Design and communicate pay structures, grades, and compensation budgets.
Advise managers on effective pay decisions supporting employee engagement and compliance with compensation policy and budgetary guidelines.
Participate in compensation surveys and conduct analysis to ensure pay equity across the organization.
Develop, implement, administer, and communicate a variety of complex compensation programs and projects.
Act as an internal technical consultant to HR, hiring managers, and other clients to identify and resolve various compensation-related issues/questions.
Evaluate market data to ensure pay structures align with company's Compensation Philosophy.
Evaluate jobs and develop/maintain job descriptions and job architecture.
Administer the compensation and salary structure in the HRIS system (ADP).
Act as a resource for company leaders for compensation and FLSA administration.
Participate in compensation surveys, conduct research, and analysis on market competitiveness, pay equity, and compensation trends.
Manage the compensation tool for annual merit and bonus payouts.
Lead compensation policy and procedure training for Managers.
May be responsible for other duties as assigned by manager.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in human resources, accounting/finance, or a business-related field. (Master's preferred)
Professional HR certification such as CCP, PHR, SPHR preferred
